5.45. 
Contents of the common matrimonial will
1. In a will, each spouse leaves to the other all his/her property.
2. The will may designate an heir to inherit the property upon the death of the surviving spouse.
3. A testamentary exclusion may be designated by a will, to be granted out of the property of either spouse after the death of the surviving spouse or out of the joint property of the spouses after the death of the surviving spouse.
4. The spouses may leave their property or part of it to a public benefit or to charity. Such a testamentary appointment may be made out of the property of either spouse after his or her death or out of the joint property of the spouses after the death of the surviving spouse.
